intro: Nasturtium flaccidum var. micranthum, commonly known as the dwarf nasturtium, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to South America. It features heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces small, bright orange or yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is characterized by its short stature, typically growing to about 15–30 cm in height. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Its flowers are edible and have a peppery taste, often used in culinary applications.
